column4: I have a 2TB drive I've been using for awhile, but I'm wiping it to use with mdadm and I'm having the weirdest error. I can fdisk just fine and create partitons, but no matter what I do, I cannot read or write sdb1. I can read/write the whole disk, and if I make two partitions, I can do whatever to sdb2, but not sdb1.
If I try to mkfs on /dev/sdb1 I get "Error getting MD array info from /dev/sdb1"  Been using Linux for 12 years and never seen this.
Could by disk be failing?
What is the exact command you are running? Can you pastebin the exact command and the entire output?
http://pastebin.com/DDrTMjhV
mdadm --create  fails on this disk too.
But no error using fdisk to *create* sdb1. Just when I try to actually do anything with it.
The pastebin you just created is already the 7'th result in google for "Error getting MD array info from".
I know, I've been searching too!
I find it odd that I can write (dd if=/dev/zero of=/dev/sdb) just fine, but writing to sdb1 fails.
And running badblocks on the disk returns no errors.
I assume that dd of=/dev/sdb1 works also?
Nope, it fails. But if I make an sdb2 I can write to that
What error message does dd give?
No space left on device
Can you pastebin the output of "sudo parted -l"?
It's hanging on that...
Can you pastebin the output of "dmesg"?
Nothing relevant in dmesg except for I/O errors on...   fd0.  I have no floppy drive.
parted finally returned. It lists the partition I created in fdisk, and it matches another identical disk I have (sdc). No errors or anything weird looking. I can pastebin it if you want
Please do.
sudo rmmod floppy
http://pastebin.com/pQiD4a9x
No idea, please file a bug report.
